definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Rough- hewn , angular notes, like stones in the wall of a churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 粗獷，生硬的音符，像墓地圍牆上的石頭般。

sentences.english: The waiters were rude and unhelpful, the manager ditto .
sentences.chinese: 這些服務員態度生硬，服務不周，經理也一樣。

sentences.english: "Thank you, " said Fleur stiffly. "I am sure zat will be lovely. "
sentences.chinese: “謝謝你，”芙蓉生硬地說，“我相信會很美麗的。”

sentences.english: He generally means well, but he is a little tactless .
sentences.chinese: 一般說他們的存心是好的，不過他對人有些生硬罷了。

sentences.english: His manner seemed rather stiff and impersonal.
sentences.chinese: 他的態度似乎很生硬冷淡。

sentences.english: There's nothing at all stiff about him.
sentences.chinese: 他的態度毫無生硬之處。

sentences.english: Grant was of humble origin, shabby in dress, rough in speech and manners.
sentences.chinese: 格蘭特出身低微，衣着腌臢，說話粗魯，態度生硬。

sentences.english: His mirthless smile made all of us uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他生硬的笑使我們感到很不舒服。

sentences.english: Secondly, the artistic conception of "Litchi Honey" seems to be pieced together stiffly.
sentences.chinese: 其次，《荔枝蜜》的意境有生硬拼湊之嫌。

sentences.english: The city of Vancouver and its sudden traffic steals into view.
sentences.chinese: 溫哥華的城市和交通生硬地侵入到我的視線中。

sentences.english: Chadwell's voice sounds much more forceful as he explains.
sentences.chinese: 查德維爾的生硬聽起來就和他的解釋一樣有說服力。
他態度生硬地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: Okay, I was a little angry when I wrote this.
sentences.chinese: 好的，當我寫這個的時候我的語氣有點生硬。

sentences.english: That might have explained the crustiness of Charlie's answer.
sentences.chinese: 這令查理的回答變得生硬起來。

sentences.english: It s so abrupt, she said, and it s very unfriendly.
sentences.chinese: “它太生硬了，”她說，“並且非常不友好。

definition: to formalize/formalism in art (esp. as proscribed in USSR and PRC)
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
